body: @rdhabalia Could you please add more color on what the dead lock is?
I think he's referring to the `PulsarWorkerAssignmentTest` test getting stuck during shutdown. There's already #3749 to fix that...though the ehm challenge is to get all these flaky to pass at once.

@srkukarni a general question:

We should definitely allow users to update receiverQueueSize config in ConsumerConfig but does it make sense for users to also be able to update schemaType and serdeClassName ?

@jerrypeng I don't see a reason not to? Afterall one can experiment with different libraries of serialization changes to test which one works better. And also we do make sure that the types etc match.

run java8 tests
run integration tests

@sijie @jiazhai Great! :+1: thanks you both for the feedback.

So when checks are success this pr will be ready to be merged!
@grantwwu how often have you seen this happen?  Did you find the exceptions you listed above in function logs or worker/broker logs?  How are you running cluster? Standalone?
@srkukarni but then why don't we allow users to update the actual input topic?  Since serde and schema are kind of tied to the topic.

In broker logs.  Running in a 3 node cluster.

Unfortunately I'm not sure we can reproduce this anymore - it was breaking clusters frequently enough (once every 1 or 2 days?, with no obvious path to recovery) that we've downgraded to 2.2.1 entirely.

I'm going to test out 2.3.1 when it comes out - we were also hitting some Jetty thread pool issues that merlimat said were getting fixed then.

run java8 tests
run integration tests

As @hrsakai pointed out, the fix was ineffective because applied on a code path that's not being used. 

The problem is that that while the cursor is set as "inactive" in the beginning, a periodic check is flipping back the state to "active": 

https://github.com/apache/pulsar/blob/43380523c5269c152f61b2aa8f7b70281c770d1d/managed-ledger/src/main/java/org/apache/bookkeeper/mledger/impl/ManagedLedgerImpl.java#L878-L885

Working on a fix.
updating input topic has the associated overhead of cleaning up subscriptions and such.
how does it help if function-worker actually has the deadlock issue?
@rdhabalia it's one part of the problem , if one test fails teardown doesn't run so it won't solve the issue but it will the right logs.
@hrsakai @massakam Did more experimentation and fixed it by making sure the dedup cursor is never considered "active" in order to never trigger caching behavior.

rerun java8 tests
rerun integration tests
rerun cpp tests

I have the same problem.
`pulsar-admin topics list public/default` or `pulsar-admin persistent list public/default`
show error 
`null
Reason: javax.ws.rs.ProcessingException: java.net.SocketTimeoutException: Read timed out`
Os Ubuntu 16 04
Pulsar 2.3.0
